summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Internal.AmazonBackupEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon Backup endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for Backup service requests. Collects values for BackupEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses BackupEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.AdvancedBackupSetting
member.summary: A list of backup options for each resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.AdvancedBackupSetting.BackupOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupOptions.
Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows VSS backup jobs.
Valid values:
Set to "WindowsVSS":"enabled" to enable the WindowsVSS backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.
Set to "WindowsVSS":"disabled" to create a regular backup. The WindowsVSS option is not enabled by default.
If you specify an invalid option, you get an InvalidParameterValueException exception.
For more information about Windows VSS backups, see Creating a VSS-Enabled Windows Backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.AdvancedBackupSetting.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Specifies an object containing resource type and backup options. The only supported resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS). For a CloudFormation example, see the sample CloudFormation template to enable Windows VSS in the Backup User Guide.
Valid values: EC2.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupJobId

Gets and sets the property BackupJobId.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupOptions.
Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs.
Valid values: Set to "WindowsVSS":"enabled" to enable the WindowsVSS backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set to "WindowsVSS":"disabled" to create a regular backup. If you specify an invalid option, you get an InvalidParameterValueException exception.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupSizeInBytes
member.summary:

The size, in bytes, of a backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupType
member.summary:

Represents the type of backup for a backup job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupVaultArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BytesTransferred
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BytesTransferred.
The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the job status was queried.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.CompletionDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionDate.
The date and time a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.CreatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedBy.
Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job, including the BackupPlanArn, BackupPlanId, BackupPlanVersion, and BackupRuleId of the backup plan used to create it.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date and time a backup job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.ExpectedCompletionDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpectedCompletionDate.
The date and time a job to back up resources is expected to be completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of ExpectedCompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.IamRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamRoleArn.
Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point. IAM roles other than the default role must include either AWSBackup or AwsBackup in the role name. For example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/AWSBackupRDSAccess. Role names without those strings lack permissions to perform backup jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.InitiationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InitiationDate.
This is the date on which the backup job was initiated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.IsParent
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IsParent.
This is a boolean value indicating this is a parent (composite) backup job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.MessageCategory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageCategory.
This parameter is the job count for the specified message category.
Example strings may include AccessDenied, SUCCESS, AGGREGATE_ALL, and INVALIDPARAMETERS. See Monitoring for a list of MessageCategory strings.
The the value ANY returns count of all message categories.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts for all message categories and returns the sum.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.ParentJobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParentJobId.
This uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource. The return will be the parent (composite) job ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.PercentDone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PercentDone.
Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job status was queried.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.ResourceName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceName.
This is the non-unique name of the resource that belongs to the specified backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.StartBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartBy.
Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the StartBy time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The value of StartBy is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The current state of a backup job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJobSummary
member.summary:
This is a summary of jobs created or running within the most recent 30 days.
The returned summary may contain the following: Region, Account, State, RestourceType, MessageCategory, StartTime, EndTime, and Count of included jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJobSummary.AccountId
member.summary:

The account ID that owns the jobs within the summary.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJobSummary.Count

The value as a number of jobs in a job summary.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJobSummary.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The value of time in number format of a job end time.
This value is the time in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJobSummary.MessageCategory
member.summary:

This parameter is the job count for the specified message category.
Example strings include AccessDenied, Success, and InvalidParameters. See Monitoring for a list of MessageCategory strings.
The the value ANY returns count of all message categories.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts for all message categories and returns the sum.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJobSummary.Region
member.summary:

The Amazon Web Services Regions within the job summary.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJobSummary.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
This value is the job count for the specified resource type. The request GetSupportedResourceTypes returns strings for supported resource types.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJobSummary.StartTime
member.summary:

The value of time in number format of a job start time.
This value is the time in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule
member.summary: Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.CompletionWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.CopyActions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CopyActions.
An array of CopyAction objects, which contains the details of the copy operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.EnableContinuousBackup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableContinuousBackup.
Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot backups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.RecoveryPointTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointTags.
An array of key-value pair strings that are assigned to resources that are associated with this rule when restored from backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.RuleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RuleId.
Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a selection of resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.RuleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RuleName.
A display name for a backup rule. Must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.ScheduleExpression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpression.
A cron expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup job. For more information about Amazon Web Services cron expressions, see Schedule Expressions for Rules in the Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide.. Two examples of Amazon Web Services cron expressions are 15 * ? * * * (take a backup every hour at 15 minutes past the hour) and 0 12 * * ? * (take a backup every day at 12 noon UTC). For a table of examples, click the preceding link and scroll down the page.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.ScheduleExpressionTimezone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpressionTimezone.
This is the timezone in which the schedule expression is set. By default, ScheduleExpressions are in UTC. You can modify this to a specified timezone.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.StartWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional. If this value is included, it must be at least 60 minutes to avoid errors.
During the start window, the backup job status remains in CREATED status until it has successfully begun or until the start window time has run out. If within the start window time Backup receives an error that allows the job to be retried, Backup will automatically retry to begin the job at least every 10 minutes until the backup successfully begins (the job status changes to RUNNING) or until the job status changes to EXPIRED (which is expected to occur when the start window time is over).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.TargetBackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetBackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput
member.summary: Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.CompletionWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.CopyActions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CopyActions.
An array of CopyAction objects, which contains the details of the copy operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.EnableContinuousBackup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableContinuousBackup.
Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot backups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.
This parameter has a maximum value of 100 years (36,500 days).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.RecoveryPointTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointTags.
To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.RuleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RuleName.
A display name for a backup rule. Must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.ScheduleExpression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpression.
A CRON expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.ScheduleExpressionTimezone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpressionTimezone.
This is the timezone in which the schedule expression is set. By default, ScheduleExpressions are in UTC. You can modify this to a specified timezone.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.StartWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional. If this value is included, it must be at least 60 minutes to avoid errors.
This parameter has a maximum value of 100 years (52,560,000 minutes).
During the start window, the backup job status remains in CREATED status until it has successfully begun or until the start window time has run out. If within the start window time Backup receives an error that allows the job to be retried, Backup will automatically retry to begin the job at least every 10 minutes until the backup successfully begins (the job status changes to RUNNING) or until the job status changes to EXPIRED (which is expected to occur when the start window time is over).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.TargetBackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetBackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupSelection
member.summary:
Used to specify a set of resources to a backup plan.
Specifying your desired Conditions, ListOfTags, NotResources, and/or Resources is recommended. If none of these are specified, Backup will attempt to select all supported and opted-in storage resources, which could have unintended cost implications.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupSelection.Conditions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Conditions.
A list of conditions that you define to assign resources to your backup plans using tags. For example, "StringEquals": { "Key": "aws:ResourceTag/CreatedByCryo", "Value": "true" },. Condition operators are case sensitive.
Conditions differs from ListOfTags as follows:
When you specify more than one condition, you only assign the resources that match ALL conditions (using AND logic).
Conditions supports StringEquals, StringLike, StringNotEquals, and StringNotLike. ListOfTags only supports StringEquals.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupSelection.IamRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamRoleArn.
The ARN of the IAM role that Backup uses to authenticate when backing up the target resource; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupSelection.ListOfTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ListOfTags.
A list of conditions that you define to assign resources to your backup plans using tags. For example, "StringEquals": { "Key": "aws:ResourceTag/CreatedByCryo", "Value": "true" },. Condition operators are case sensitive.
ListOfTags differs from Conditions as follows:
When you specify more than one condition, you assign all resources that match AT LEAST ONE condition (using OR logic).
ListOfTags only supports StringEquals. Conditions supports StringEquals, StringLike, StringNotEquals, and StringNotLike.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupSelection.NotResources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NotResources.
A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to exclude from a backup plan. The maximum number of ARNs is 500 without wildcards, or 30 ARNs with wildcards.
If you need to exclude many resources from a backup plan, consider a different resource selection strategy, such as assigning only one or a few resource types or refining your resource selection using tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupSelection.Resources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Resources.
A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) to assign to a backup plan. The maximum number of ARNs is 500 without wildcards, or 30 ARNs with wildcards.
If you need to assign many resources to a backup plan, consider a different resource selection strategy, such as assigning all resources of a resource type or refining your resource selection using tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupSelection.SelectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SelectionName.
The display name of a resource selection document. Must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.summary:

The date and time a backup plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice. This parameter is optional.
If used, this parameter must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date and time a resource backup is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.CreatorRequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatorRequestId.
A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice. This parameter is optional.
If used, this parameter must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.EncryptionKeyArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKeyArn.
A server-side encryption key you can specify to encrypt your backups from services that support full Backup management; for example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab. If you specify a key, you must specify its ARN, not its alias. If you do not specify a key, Backup creates a KMS key for you by default.
To learn which Backup services support full Backup management and how Backup handles encryption for backups from services that do not yet support full Backup, see Encryption for backups in Backup

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.LockDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockDate.
The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration becomes immutable, meaning it cannot be changed or deleted.
If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock date, you can change your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock from the vault entirely, at any time.
This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.Locked
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Locked.
A Boolean value that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock applies to the selected backup vault. If true, Vault Lock prevents delete and update operations on the recovery points in the selected vault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.MaxRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite storage).
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.MinRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention period.
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.NumberOfRecoveryPoints
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfRecoveryPoints.
The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CalculatedLifecycle
member.summary:
Contains DeleteAt and MoveToColdStorageAt timestamps, which are used to specify a lifecycle for a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CalculatedLifecycle.DeleteAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeleteAt.
A timestamp that specifies when to delete a recovery point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CalculatedLifecycle.MoveToColdStorageAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MoveToColdStorageAt.
A timestamp that specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold storage.

String describing the reason for removing the legal hold.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CancelLegalHoldRequest.LegalHoldId
member.summary:

Legal hold ID required to remove the specified legal hold on a recovery point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CancelLegalHoldRequest.RetainRecordInDays
member.summary:

The integer amount in days specifying amount of days after this API operation to remove legal hold.

member.summary: This is the response object from the CancelLegalHold operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.Condition
member.summary: Contains an array of triplets made up of a condition type (such as StringEquals), a key, and a value. Used to filter resources using their tags and assign them to a backup plan. Case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Condition.ConditionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConditionKey.
The key in a key-value pair. For example, in the tag Department: Accounting, Department is the key.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Condition.ConditionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConditionType.
An operation applied to a key-value pair used to assign resources to your backup plan. Condition only supports StringEquals. For more flexible assignment options, including StringLike and the ability to exclude resources from your backup plan, use Conditions (with an "s" on the end) for your BackupSelection .

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Condition.ConditionValue
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConditionValue.
The value in a key-value pair. For example, in the tag Department: Accounting, Accounting is the value.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ConditionParameter
member.summary: Includes information about tags you define to assign tagged resources to a backup plan.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ConditionParameter.ConditionKey
member.summary:

The key in a key-value pair. For example, in the tag Department: Accounting, Department is the key.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ConditionParameter.ConditionValue
member.summary:

The value in a key-value pair. For example, in the tag Department: Accounting, Accounting is the value.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.Conditions
member.summary: Contains information about which resources to include or exclude from a backup plan using their tags. Conditions are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Conditions.StringEquals
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StringEquals.
Filters the values of your tagged resources for only those resources that you tagged with the same value. Also called "exact matching."

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Conditions.StringLike
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StringLike.
Filters the values of your tagged resources for matching tag values with the use of a wildcard character (*) anywhere in the string. For example, "prod*" or "*rod*" matches the tag value "production".

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Conditions.StringNotEquals
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StringNotEquals.
Filters the values of your tagged resources for only those resources that you tagged that do not have the same value. Also called "negated matching."

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Conditions.StringNotLike
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StringNotLike.
Filters the values of your tagged resources for non-matching tag values with the use of a wildcard character (*) anywhere in the string.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ControlInputParameter
member.summary: A list of parameters for a control. A control can have zero, one, or more than one parameter. An example of a control with two parameters is: "backup plan frequency is at least daily and the retention period is at least 1 year". The first parameter is daily. The second parameter is 1 year.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ControlScope
member.summary:
A framework consists of one or more controls. Each control has its own control scope. The control scope can include one or more resource types, a combination of a tag key and value, or a combination of one resource type and one resource ID. If no scope is specified, evaluations for the rule are triggered when any resource in your recording group changes in configuration.
To set a control scope that includes all of a particular resource, leave the ControlScope empty or do not pass it when calling CreateFramework.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ControlScope.ComplianceResourceIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ComplianceResourceIds.
The ID of the only Amazon Web Services resource that you want your control scope to contain.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ControlScope.ComplianceResourceTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ComplianceResourceTypes.
Describes whether the control scope includes one or more types of resources, such as EFS or RDS.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ControlScope.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The tag key-value pair applied to those Amazon Web Services resources that you want to trigger an evaluation for a rule. A maximum of one key-value pair can be provided. The tag value is optional, but it cannot be an empty string. The structure to assign a tag is: [{"Key":"string","Value":"string"}].

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupPlanRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateBackupPlan operation. Creates a backup plan using a backup plan name and backup rules. A backup plan is a document that contains information that Backup uses to schedule tasks that create recovery points for resources.
If you call CreateBackupPlan with a plan that already exists, you receive an AlreadyExistsException exception.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupPlanRequest.BackupPlan
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupPlan.
Specifies the body of a backup plan. Includes a BackupPlanName and one or more sets of Rules.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupPlanRequest.BackupPlanTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupPlanTags.
To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair. The specified tags are assigned to all backups created with this plan.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupPlanRequest.CreatorRequestId
member.summary:

A framework is a collection of controls that you can use to evaluate your backup practices. member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLegalHoldRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateLegalHold operation. This action creates a legal hold on a recovery point (backup). A legal hold is a restraint on altering or deleting a backup until an authorized user cancels the legal hold. Any actions to delete or disassociate a recovery point will fail with an error if one or more active legal holds are on the recovery point.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVault operation. This request creates a logical container to where backups may be copied.
This request includes a name, the Region, the maximum number of retention days, the minimum number of retention days, and optionally can include tags and a creator request ID.
Do not include sensitive data, such as passport numbers, in the name of a backup vault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
This is the name of the vault that is being created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultRequest.BackupVaultTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultTags.
These are the tags that will be included in the newly-created vault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultRequest.CreatorRequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatorRequestId.
This is the ID of the creation request.
This parameter is optional. If used, this parameter must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultRequest.MaxRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRetentionDays.
This is the setting that specifies the maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Backup does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite storage).
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job retention period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultRequest.MinRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinRetentionDays.
This setting specifies the minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, no minimum retention period is enforced.
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the minimum retention period. If a job retention period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVault operation.

member.summary:

This is the ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the vault being created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultResponse.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Logically air-gapped backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultResponse.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date and time when the vault was created.
This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultResponse.VaultState
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VaultState.
This is the current state of the vault.

Container for the parameters to the CreateReportPlan operation. Creates a report plan. A report plan is a document that contains information about the contents of the report and where Backup will deliver it.
If you call CreateReportPlan with a plan that already exists, you receive an AlreadyExistsException exception.

member.summary:

A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to CreateReportPlanInput. Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateReportPlanRequest.ReportDeliveryChannel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportDeliveryChannel.
A structure that contains information about where and how to deliver your reports, specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the formats of your reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateReportPlanRequest.ReportPlanDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanDescription.
An optional description of the report plan with a maximum of 1,024 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateReportPlanRequest.ReportPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanName.
The unique name of the report plan. The name must be between 1 and 256 characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateReportPlanRequest.ReportPlanTags
member.summary:

Metadata that you can assign to help organize the report plans that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateReportPlanRequest.ReportSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportSetting.
Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report templates are:
RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
If the report template is RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT or CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT, this API resource also describes the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingPlanRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateRestoreTestingPlan operation. This is the first of two steps to create a restore testing plan; once this request is successful, finish the procedure with request CreateRestoreTestingSelection.
You must include the parameter RestoreTestingPlan. You may optionally include CreatorRequestId and Tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingPlanRequest.CreatorRequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatorRequestId.
This is a unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retriedwithout the risk of running the operation twice. This parameter is optional. If used, this parameter must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingPlanRequest.RestoreTestingPlan
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlan.
A restore testing plan must contain a unique RestoreTestingPlanName string you create and must contain a ScheduleExpression cron. You may optionally include a StartWindowHours integer and a CreatorRequestId string.
The RestoreTestingPlanName is a unique string that is the name of the restore testing plan. This cannot be changed after creation, and it must consist of only alphanumeric characters and underscores.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingPlanRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Optional tags to include. A tag is a key-value pair you can use to manage, filter, and search for your resources. Allowed characters include UTF-8 letters,numbers, spaces, and the following characters: + - = . _ : /.

member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateRestoreTestingPlan operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingPlanResponse.CreationTime
member.summary:

The date and time a restore testing plan was created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingPlanResponse.RestoreTestingPlanArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the created restore testing plan.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingPlanResponse.RestoreTestingPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanName.
This unique string is the name of the restore testing plan.
The name cannot be changed after creation. The name consists of only alphanumeric characters and underscores. Maximum length is 50.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateRestoreTestingSelection operation. This request can be sent after CreateRestoreTestingPlan request returns successfully. This is the second part of creating a resource testing plan, and it must be completed sequentially.
This consists of RestoreTestingSelectionName, ProtectedResourceType, and one of the following:
ProtectedResourceArns
ProtectedResourceConditions
Each protected resource type can have one single value.
A restore testing selection can include a wildcard value ("*") for ProtectedResourceArns along with ProtectedResourceConditions. Alternatively, you can include up to 30 specific protected resource ARNs in ProtectedResourceArns.
Cannot select by both protected resource types AND specific ARNs. Request will fail if both are included.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest.CreatorRequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatorRequestId.
This is an optional unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice. If used, this parameter must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest.RestoreTestingPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanName.
Input the restore testing plan name that was returned from the related CreateRestoreTestingPlan request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest.RestoreTestingSelection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingSelection.
This consists of RestoreTestingSelectionName, ProtectedResourceType, and one of the following:
ProtectedResourceArns
ProtectedResourceConditions
Each protected resource type can have one single value.
A restore testing selection can include a wildcard value ("*") for ProtectedResourceArns along with ProtectedResourceConditions. Alternatively, you can include up to 30 specific protected resource ARNs in ProtectedResourceArns.

member.summary:

Unique string that is the name of the restore testing plan.

The date and time are in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and it is accurate to milliseconds ((milliseconds are optional). For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

If the Vault Lock configuration is immutable, then you cannot delete Vault Lock using API operations, and you will receive an InvalidRequestException if you attempt to do so. For more information, see Vault Lock in the Backup Developer Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.DeleteRecoveryPointRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteRecoveryPoint operation. Deletes the recovery point specified by a recovery point ID.
If the recovery point ID belongs to a continuous backup, calling this endpoint deletes the existing continuous backup and stops future continuous backup.
When an IAM role's permissions are insufficient to call this API, the service sends back an HTTP 200 response with an empty HTTP body, but the recovery point is not deleted. Instead, it enters an EXPIRED state.
EXPIRED recovery points can be deleted with this API once the IAM role has the iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole action. To learn more about adding this role, see Troubleshooting manual deletions.
If the user or role is deleted or the permission within the role is removed, the deletion will not be successful and will enter an EXPIRED state.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupJobResponse.StartBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartBy.
Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the StartBy time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The value of StartBy is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.summary:

The current state of a backup job.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date and time that a backup vault is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.CreatorRequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatorRequestId.
A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice. This parameter is optional. If used, this parameter must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.EncryptionKeyArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKeyArn.
The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.LockDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockDate.
The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration cannot be changed or deleted.
If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock date, you can change any of your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock from the vault entirely, at any time.
This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.Locked
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Locked.
A Boolean that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock is currently protecting the backup vault. True means that Vault Lock causes delete or update operations on the recovery points stored in the vault to fail.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.MaxRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite storage).
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.MinRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention period.
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.NumberOfRecoveryPoints
member.summary:

The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.

This is the type of vault described.

A list of the controls that make up the framework. Each control in the list has a name, input parameters, and scope.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeFrameworkResponse.FrameworkDescription
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeFrameworkResponse.FrameworkName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FrameworkName.
The unique name of a framework.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeFrameworkResponse.FrameworkStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FrameworkStatus.
A framework consists of one or more controls. Each control governs a resource, such as backup plans, backup selections, backup vaults, or recovery points. You can also turn Config recording on or off for each resource. The statuses are:
ACTIVE when recording is turned on for all resources governed by the framework.
PARTIALLY_ACTIVE when recording is turned off for at least one resource governed by the framework.
INACTIVE when recording is turned off for all resources governed by the framework.
UNAVAILABLE when Backup is unable to validate recording status at this time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeFrameworkResponse.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:

A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to DescribeFrameworkOutput. Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.LastRestoreTime
member.summary:

The date and time that a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastRestoreTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups that are transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.ParentRecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParentRecoveryPointArn.
This is an ARN that uniquely identifies a parent (composite) recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:

An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.ResourceArn
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.ResourceName

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.ResourceType
member.summary:

The type of Amazon Web Services resource to save as a recovery point; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.SourceBackupVaultArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceBackupVaultArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the source vault where the resource was originally backed up in; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:BackupVault. If the recovery is restored to the same Amazon Web Services account or Region, this value will be null.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
PARTIAL status indicates Backup could not create the recovery point before the backup window closed. To increase your backup plan window using the API, see UpdateBackupPlan. You can also increase your backup plan window using the Console by choosing and editing your backup plan.
EXPIRED status indicates that the recovery point has exceeded its retention period, but Backup lacks permission or is otherwise unable to delete it. To manually delete these recovery points, see Step 3: Delete the recovery points in the Clean up resources section of Getting started.
STOPPED status occurs on a continuous backup where a user has taken some action that causes the continuous backup to be disabled. This can be caused by the removal of permissions, turning off versioning, turning off events being sent to EventBridge, or disabling the EventBridge rules that are put in place by Backup.
To resolve STOPPED status, ensure that all requested permissions are in place and that versioning is enabled on the S3 bucket. Once these conditions are met, the next instance of a backup rule running will result in a new continuous recovery point being created. The recovery points with STOPPED status do not need to be deleted.
For SAP HANA on Amazon EC2 STOPPED status occurs due to user action, application misconfiguration, or backup failure. To ensure that future continuous backups succeed, refer to the recovery point status and check SAP HANA for details.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
A status message explaining the status of the recovery point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.StorageClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageClass.
Specifies the storage class of the recovery point. Valid values are WARM or COLD.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRegionSettingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeRegionSettings operation. Returns the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If service opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does not try to protect that service's resources in this Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRegionSettingsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeRegionSettings operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRegionSettingsResponse.ResourceTypeManagementPreference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTypeManagementPreference.
Returns whether Backup fully manages the backups for a resource type.
For the benefits of full Backup management, see Full Backup management.
For a list of resource types and whether each supports full Backup management, see the Feature availability by resource table.
If "DynamoDB":false, you can enable full Backup management for DynamoDB backup by enabling Backup's advanced DynamoDB backup features.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRegionSettingsResponse.ResourceTypeOptInPreference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTypeOptInPreference.
Returns a list of all services along with the opt-in preferences in the Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.DisassociateRecoveryPointRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DisassociateRecoveryPoint operation. Deletes the specified continuous backup recovery point from Backup and releases control of that continuous backup to the source service, such as Amazon RDS. The source service will continue to create and retain continuous backups using the lifecycle that you specified in your original backup plan.
Does not support snapshot backup recovery points.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.KeyValue
member.summary: Pair of two related strings. Allowed characters are letters, white space, and numbers that can be represented in UTF-8 and the following characters: + - = . _ : /

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.KeyValue.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
The tag key (String). The key can't start with aws:.
Length Constraints: Minimum length of 1. Maximum length of 128.
Pattern: ^(?![aA]{1}[wW]{1}[sS]{1}:)([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]+)$

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.KeyValue.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
The value of the key.
Length Constraints: Maximum length of 256.
Pattern: ^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.LegalHold
member.summary: A legal hold is an administrative tool that helps prevent backups from being deleted while under a hold. While the hold is in place, backups under a hold cannot be deleted and lifecycle policies that would alter the backup status (such as transition to cold storage) are delayed until the legal hold is removed. A backup can have more than one legal hold. Legal holds are applied to one or more backups (also known as recovery points). These backups can be filtered by resource types and by resource IDs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.LegalHold.CancellationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CancellationDate.
This is the time in number format when legal hold was cancelled.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.LegalHold.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
This is the time in number format when legal hold was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.LegalHold.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
This is the description of a legal hold.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.LegalHold.LegalHoldArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LegalHoldArn.
This is an Amazon Resource Number (ARN) that uniquely identifies the legal hold; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.LegalHold.LegalHoldId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LegalHoldId.
ID of specific legal hold on one or more recovery points.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.LegalHold.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
This is the status of the legal hold. Statuses can be ACTIVE, CREATING, CANCELED, and CANCELING.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.LegalHold.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
This is the title of a legal hold.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Contains an array of Transition objects specifying how long in days before a recovery point transitions to cold storage or is deleted.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, on the console, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Lifecycle.DeleteAfterDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeleteAfterDays.
Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Lifecycle.MoveToColdStorageAfterDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.
Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Lifecycle.OptInToArchiveForSupportedResources
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OptInToArchiveForSupportedResources.
Optional Boolean. If this is true, this setting will instruct your backup plan to transition supported resources to archive (cold) storage tier in accordance with your lifecycle settings.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListBackupJobs operation. Returns a list of existing backup jobs for an authenticated account for the last 30 days. For a longer period of time, consider using these monitoring tools.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByAccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByAccountId.
The account ID to list the jobs from. Returns only backup jobs associated with the specified account ID.
If used from an Organizations management account, passing * returns all jobs across the organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByBackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByBackupVaultName.
Returns only backup jobs that will be stored in the specified backup vault. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByCompleteAfter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByCompleteAfter.
Returns only backup jobs completed after a date expressed in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByCompleteBefore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByCompleteBefore.
Returns only backup jobs completed before a date expressed in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByCreatedAfter
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByCreatedAfter.
Returns only backup jobs that were created after the specified date.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByCreatedBefore
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByCreatedBefore.
Returns only backup jobs that were created before the specified date.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByMessageCategory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByMessageCategory.
This is an optional parameter that can be used to filter out jobs with a MessageCategory which matches the value you input.
Example strings may include AccessDenied, SUCCESS, AGGREGATE_ALL, and InvalidParameters.
View Monitoring
The wildcard () returns count of all message categories.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts for all message categories and returns the sum.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByParentJobId.
This is a filter to list child (nested) jobs based on parent job ID.

member.summary:

Returns only backup jobs that match the specified resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

member.summary:

Returns only backup jobs for the specified resources:
Aurora for Amazon Aurora

DynamoDB for Amazon DynamoDB
EBS for Amazon Elastic Block Store
EC2 for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
EFS for Amazon Elastic File System
FSx for Amazon FSx

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobSummariesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListBackupJobSummaries operation. This is a request for a summary of backup jobs created or running within the most recent 30 days. You can include parameters AccountID, State, ResourceType, MessageCategory, AggregationPeriod, MaxResults, or NextToken to filter results.
This request returns a summary that contains Region, Account, State, ResourceType, MessageCategory, StartTime, EndTime, and Count of included jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobSummariesRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Returns the job count for the specified account.
If the request is sent from a member account or an account not part of Amazon Web Services Organizations, jobs within requestor's account will be returned.
Root, admin, and delegated administrator accounts can use the value ANY to return job counts from every account in the organization.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts from all accounts within the authenticated organization, then returns the sum.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobSummariesRequest.AggregationPeriod
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AggregationPeriod.
This is the period that sets the boundaries for returned results.
Acceptable values include
ONE_DAY for daily job count for the prior 14 days.
SEVEN_DAYS for the aggregated job count for the prior 7 days.
FOURTEEN_DAYS for aggregated job count for prior 14 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobSummariesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
This parameter sets the maximum number of items to be returned.
The value is an integer. Range of accepted values is from 1 to 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobSummariesRequest.MessageCategory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MessageCategory.
This parameter returns the job count for the specified message category.
Example accepted strings include AccessDenied, Success, and InvalidParameters. See Monitoring for a list of accepted MessageCategory strings.
The the value ANY returns count of all message categories.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts for all message categories and returns the sum.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobSummariesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The next item following a partial list of returned resources. For example, if a request is made to return MaxResults number of resources, NextToken allows you to return more items in your list starting at the location pointed to by the next token.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobSummariesRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Returns the job count for the specified resource type. Use request GetSupportedResourceTypes to obtain strings for supported resource types.
The the value ANY returns count of all resource types.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts for all resource types and returns the sum.
The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobSummariesRequest.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
This parameter returns the job count for jobs with the specified state.
The the value ANY returns count of all states.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts for all states and returns the sum.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListRestoreJobSummaries operation. This request obtains a summary of restore jobs created or running within the the most recent 30 days. You can include parameters AccountID, State, ResourceType, AggregationPeriod, MaxResults, or NextToken to filter results.
This request returns a summary that contains Region, Account, State, RestourceType, MessageCategory, StartTime, EndTime, and Count of included jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
Returns the job count for the specified account.
If the request is sent from a member account or an account not part of Amazon Web Services Organizations, jobs within requestor's account will be returned.
Root, admin, and delegated administrator accounts can use the value ANY to return job counts from every account in the organization.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts from all accounts within the authenticated organization, then returns the sum.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesRequest.AggregationPeriod
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AggregationPeriod.
This is the period that sets the boundaries for returned results.
Acceptable values include
ONE_DAY for daily job count for the prior 14 days.
SEVEN_DAYS for the aggregated job count for the prior 7 days.
FOURTEEN_DAYS for aggregated job count for prior 14 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
This parameter sets the maximum number of items to be returned.
The value is an integer. Range of accepted values is from 1 to 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The next item following a partial list of returned resources. For example, if a request is made to return MaxResults number of resources, NextToken allows you to return more items in your list starting at the location pointed to by the next token.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Returns the job count for the specified resource type. Use request GetSupportedResourceTypes to obtain strings for supported resource types.
The the value ANY returns count of all resource types.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts for all resource types and returns the sum.
The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesRequest.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
This parameter returns the job count for jobs with the specified state.
The the value ANY returns count of all states.
AGGREGATE_ALL aggregates job counts for all states and returns the sum.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListRestoreJobSummaries operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesResponse.AggregationPeriod
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AggregationPeriod.
This is the period that sets the boundaries for returned results.
ONE_DAY for daily job count for the prior 14 days.
SEVEN_DAYS for the aggregated job count for the prior 7 days.
FOURTEEN_DAYS for aggregated job count for prior 14 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListRestoreJobSummariesResponse.NextToken
member.summary:

member.summary:

This return contains a summary that contains Region, Account, State, ResourceType, MessageCategory, StartTime, EndTime, and Count of included jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ProtectedResourceConditions.StringEquals

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultAccessPolicyRequest.Policy

The backup vault access policy document in JSON format.
