member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration operation. Applies Backup Vault Lock to a backup vault, preventing attempts to delete any recovery point stored in or created in a backup vault. Vault Lock also prevents attempts to update the lifecycle policy that controls the retention period of any recovery point currently stored in a backup vault. If specified, Vault Lock enforces a minimum and maximum retention period for future backup and copy jobs that target a backup vault.
Backup Vault Lock has been assessed by Cohasset Associates for use in environments that are subject to SEC 17a-4, CFTC, and FINRA regulations. For more information about how Backup Vault Lock relates to these regulations, see the Cohasset Associates Compliance Assessment.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the name of the backup vault it protects.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest.ChangeableForDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChangeableForDays.
The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the number of days before the lock date. For example, setting ChangeableForDays to 30 on Jan. 1, 2022 at 8pm UTC will set the lock date to Jan. 31, 2022 at 8pm UTC.
Backup enforces a 72-hour cooling-off period before Vault Lock takes effect and becomes immutable. Therefore, you must set ChangeableForDays to 3 or greater.
Before the lock date, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration or change the Vault Lock configuration using PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration. On and after the lock date, the Vault Lock becomes immutable and cannot be changed or deleted.
If this parameter is not specified, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration or change the Vault Lock configuration using PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration at any time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest.MaxRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies require you to destroy certain data after retaining it for four years (1460 days).
If this parameter is not included, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault. If this parameter is included without a value, Vault Lock will not enforce a maximum retention period.
If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. The longest maximum retention period you can specify is 36500 days (approximately 100 years). Recovery points already saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest.MinRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies require you to retain certain data for at least seven years (2555 days).
If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock will not enforce a minimum retention period.
If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails that backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. The shortest minimum retention period you can specify is 1 day. Recovery points already saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultNotificationsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutBackupVaultNotifications operation. Turns on notifications on a backup vault for the specified topic and events.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultNotificationsRequest.BackupVaultEvents
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultEvents.
An array of events that indicate the status of jobs to back up resources to the backup vault.
For common use cases and code samples, see Using Amazon SNS to track Backup events.
The following events are supported:
BACKUP_JOB_STARTED | BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED
COPY_JOB_STARTED | COPY_JOB_SUCCESSFUL | COPY_JOB_FAILED
RESTORE_JOB_STARTED | RESTORE_JOB_COMPLETED | RECOVERY_POINT_MODIFIED
S3_BACKUP_OBJECT_FAILED | S3_RESTORE_OBJECT_FAILED
The list below shows items that are deprecated events (for reference) and are no longer in use. They are no longer supported and will not return statuses or notifications. Refer to the list above for current supported events.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultNotificationsRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultNotificationsRequest.SNSTopicArn

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.LastRestoreTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastRestoreTime.
The date and time a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastRestoreTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.

The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.ReportDestination

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.ReportJobId
member.summary:

The identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report job IDs cannot be edited.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.ReportPlanArn
member.summary:

An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.ReportTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportTemplate.
Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report templates are:
RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of a report job. The statuses are:
CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
COMPLETED means that the report is available for your review at your designated destination. If the status is FAILED, review the StatusMessage for the reason.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
A message explaining the status of the report job.

The value of LastAttemptedExecutionTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

The value of LastSuccessfulExecutionTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.summary:

Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report templates are:
RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
If the report template is RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT or CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT, this API resource also describes the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreJobSummary
member.summary:
This is a summary of restore jobs created or running within the most recent 30 days.
The returned summary may contain the following: Region, Account, State, ResourceType, MessageCategory, StartTime, EndTime, and Count of included jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreJobSummary.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The account ID that owns the jobs within the summary.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreJobSummary.Count
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Count.
The value as a number of jobs in a job summary.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreJobSummary.EndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndTime.
The value of time in number format of a job end time.
This value is the time in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreJobSummary.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
The Amazon Web Services Regions within the job summary.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreJobSummary.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
This value is the job count for the specified resource type. The request GetSupportedResourceTypes returns strings for supported resource types.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreJobSummary.StartTime
member.summary:

The value of time in number format of a job start time.
This value is the time in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreJobSummary.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
This value is job count for jobs with the specified state.

member.summary:

Required: Algorithm; Required: Recovery point types; IncludeVaults (one or more). Optional: SelectionWindowDays ('30' if not specified); ExcludeVaults (list of selectors), defaults to empty list if not listed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingPlanForCreate.RestoreTestingPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanName.
The RestoreTestingPlanName is a unique string that is the name of the restore testing plan. This cannot be changed after creation, and it must consist of only alphanumeric characters and underscores.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingPlanForCreate.ScheduleExpression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpression.
A CRON expression in specified timezone when a restore testing plan is executed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingPlanForCreate.ScheduleExpressionTimezone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpressionTimezone.
Optional. This is the timezone in which the schedule expression is set. By default, ScheduleExpressions are in UTC. You can modify this to a specified timezone.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingPlanForCreate.StartWindowHours
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartWindowHours.
Defaults to 24 hours.
A value in hours after a restore test is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional. If this value is included, this parameter has a maximum value of 168 hours (one week).

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingPlanForGet

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingPlanForGet.CreatorRequestId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatorRequestId.
This identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of running the operation twice. If the request includes a CreatorRequestId that matches an existing backup plan, that plan is returned. This parameter is optional.
If used, this parameter must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.summary: Required: Algorithm; Required: Recovery point types; IncludeVaults(one or more). Optional: SelectionWindowDays ('30' if not specified);ExcludeVaults (list of selectors), defaults to empty list if not listed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingRecoveryPointSelection.Algorithm
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingRecoveryPointSelection.ExcludeVaults
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingRecoveryPointSelection.IncludeVaults
member.summary:

Accepted values include wildcard ["*"] or by specific ARNs or ARN wilcard replacement ["arn:aws:backup:us-west-2:123456789012:backup-vault:asdf", ...] ["arn:aws:backup:*:*:backup-vault:asdf-*", ...]

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingRecoveryPointSelection.RecoveryPointTypes
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingRecoveryPointSelection.SelectionWindowDays
member.summary:

Accepted values are integers from 1 to 365.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForCreate
member.summary:
This contains metadata about a specific restore testing selection.
ProtectedResourceType is required, such as Amazon EBS or Amazon EC2.
This consists of RestoreTestingSelectionName, ProtectedResourceType, and one of the following:
ProtectedResourceArns
ProtectedResourceConditions
Each protected resource type can have one single value.
A restore testing selection can include a wildcard value ("*") for ProtectedResourceArns along with ProtectedResourceConditions. Alternatively, you can include up to 30 specific protected resource ARNs in ProtectedResourceArns.
ProtectedResourceConditions examples include as StringEquals and StringNotEquals.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForCreate.IamRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Backup uses to create the target resource; for example: arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForCreate.ProtectedResourceArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProtectedResourceArns.
Each protected resource can be filtered by its specific ARNs, such as ProtectedResourceArns: ["arn:aws:...", "arn:aws:..."] or by a wildcard: ProtectedResourceArns: ["*"], but not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForCreate.ProtectedResourceConditions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProtectedResourceConditions.
If you have included the wildcard in ProtectedResourceArns, you can include resource conditions, such as ProtectedResourceConditions: { StringEquals: [{ key: "XXXX", value: "YYYY" }].

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForCreate.ProtectedResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProtectedResourceType.
The type of Amazon Web Services resource included in a restore testing selection; for example, an Amazon EBS volume or an Amazon RDS database.
Supported resource types accepted include:
Aurora for Amazon Aurora
DocumentDB for Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility)
DynamoDB for Amazon DynamoDB
EBS for Amazon Elastic Block Store
EC2 for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
EFS for Amazon Elastic File System
FSx for Amazon FSx
Neptune for Amazon Neptune
RDS for Amazon Relational Database Service
S3 for Amazon S3

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForCreate.RestoreMetadataOverrides
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreMetadataOverrides.
You can override certain restore metadata keys by including the parameter RestoreMetadataOverrides in the body of RestoreTestingSelection. Key values are not case sensitive.
See the complete list of restore testing inferred metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForCreate.RestoreTestingSelectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingSelectionName.
This is the unique name of the restore testing selection that belongs to the related restore testing plan.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForCreate.ValidationWindowHours
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ValidationWindowHours.
This is amount of hours (1 to 168) available to run a validation script on the data. The data will be deleted upon the completion of the validation script or the end of the specified retention period, whichever comes first.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RestoreTestingSelectionForGet.CreatorRequestId
member.summary:

If used, this parameter must contain 1 to 50 alphanumeric or '-_.' characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartBackupJob operation. Starts an on-demand backup job for the specified resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.BackupOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupOptions.
Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs.
Valid values: Set to "WindowsVSS":"enabled" to enable the WindowsVSS backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set to "WindowsVSS""disabled" to create a regular backup. The WindowsVSS option is not enabled by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.CompleteWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompleteWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes during which a successfully started backup must complete, or else Backup will cancel the job. This value is optional. This value begins counting down from when the backup was scheduled. It does not add additional time for StartWindowMinutes, or if the backup started later than scheduled.
Like StartWindowMinutes, this parameter has a maximum value of 100 years (52,560,000 minutes).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.IamRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamRoleArn.
Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to StartBackupJob. Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.
This parameter has a maximum value of 100 years (36,500 days).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.RecoveryPointTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointTags.
To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.StartWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional, and the default is 8 hours. If this value is included, it must be at least 60 minutes to avoid errors.
This parameter has a maximum value of 100 years (52,560,000 minutes).
During the start window, the backup job status remains in CREATED status until it has successfully begun or until the start window time has run out. If within the start window time Backup receives an error that allows the job to be retried, Backup will automatically retry to begin the job at least every 10 minutes until the backup successfully begins (the job status changes to RUNNING) or until the job status changes to EXPIRED (which is expected to occur when the start window time is over).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.CopySourceTagsToRestoredResource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CopySourceTagsToRestoredResource.
This is an optional parameter. If this equals True, tags included in the backup will be copied to the restored resource.
This can only be applied to backups created through Backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.IamRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Backup uses to create the target resource; for example: arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to StartRestoreJob. Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.Metadata
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metadata.
A set of metadata key-value pairs. Contains information, such as a resource name, required to restore a recovery point.
You can get configuration metadata about a resource at the time it was backed up by calling GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata. However, values in addition to those provided by GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata might be required to restore a resource. For example, you might need to provide a new resource name if the original already exists.
You need to specify specific metadata to restore an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) instance:
file-system-id: The ID of the Amazon EFS file system that is backed up by Backup. Returned in GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata.
Encrypted: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that the file system is encrypted. If KmsKeyId is specified, Encrypted must be set to true.
KmsKeyId: Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key that is used to encrypt the restored file system. You can specify a key from another Amazon Web Services account provided that key it is properly shared with your account via Amazon Web Services KMS.
PerformanceMode: Specifies the throughput mode of the file system.
CreationToken: A user-supplied value that ensures the uniqueness (idempotency) of the request.
newFileSystem: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that the recovery point is restored to a new Amazon EFS file system.
ItemsToRestore: An array of one to five strings where each string is a file path. Use ItemsToRestore to restore specific files or directories rather than the entire file system. This parameter is optional. For example, "itemsToRestore":"[\"/my.test\"]".

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Starts a job to restore a recovery point for one of the following resources:
Aurora for Amazon Aurora
DocumentDB for Amazon DocumentDB (with MongoDB compatibility)
CloudFormation for CloudFormation
DynamoDB for Amazon DynamoDB
EBS for Amazon Elastic Block Store
EC2 for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
EFS for Amazon Elastic File System
FSx for Amazon FSx
Neptune for Amazon Neptune
RDS for Amazon Relational Database Service
Redshift for Amazon Redshift
Storage Gateway for Storage Gateway
S3 for Amazon S3
Timestream for Amazon Timestream
VirtualMachine for virtual machines

The unique name of a framework. This name is between 1 and 256 characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateGlobalSettingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateGlobalSettings operation. Updates whether the Amazon Web Services account is opted in to cross-account backup. Returns an error if the account is not an Organizations management account. Use the DescribeGlobalSettings API to determine the current settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateGlobalSettingsRequest.GlobalSettings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GlobalSettings.
A value for isCrossAccountBackupEnabled and a Region. Example: update-global-settings --global-settings isCrossAccountBackupEnabled=false --region us-west-2.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateGlobalSettingsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateGlobalSettings operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle operation. Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.
This operation does not support continuous backups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse.BackupVaultArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse.CalculatedLifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CalculatedLifecycle.
A CalculatedLifecycle object containing DeleteAt and MoveToColdStorageAt timestamps.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateRegionSettings operation. Updates the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If service-opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does not try to protect that service's resources in this Region. Use the DescribeRegionSettings API to determine the resource types that are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsRequest.ResourceTypeManagementPreference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTypeManagementPreference.
Enables or disables full Backup management of backups for a resource type. To enable full Backup management for DynamoDB along with Backup's advanced DynamoDB backup features, follow the procedure to enable advanced DynamoDB backup programmatically.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsRequest.ResourceTypeOptInPreference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTypeOptInPreference.
Updates the list of services along with the opt-in preferences for the Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateRegionSettings operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateReportPlan operation. Updates an existing report plan identified by its ReportPlanName with the input document in JSON format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to UpdateReportPlanInput. Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.ReportDeliveryChannel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportDeliveryChannel.
A structure that contains information about where to deliver your reports, specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the formats of your reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.ReportPlanDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanDescription.
An optional description of the report plan with a maximum 1,024 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.ReportPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanName.
The unique name of the report plan. This name is between 1 and 256 characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.ReportSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportSetting.
Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report templates are:
RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
If the report template is RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT or CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT, this API resource also describes the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateReportPlan operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanResponse.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanResponse.ReportPlanArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanResponse.ReportPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanName.
The unique name of the report plan.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingPlanRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateRestoreTestingPlan operation. This request will send changes to your specified restore testing plan. RestoreTestingPlanName cannot be updated after it is created.
RecoveryPointSelection can contain:
Algorithm
ExcludeVaults
IncludeVaults
RecoveryPointTypes
SelectionWindowDays

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingPlanRequest.RestoreTestingPlan
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlan.
Specifies the body of a restore testing plan.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingPlanRequest.RestoreTestingPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanName.
This is the restore testing plan name you wish to update.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingPlanResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateRestoreTestingPlan operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingPlanResponse.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
This is the time the resource testing plan was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingPlanResponse.RestoreTestingPlanArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanArn.
Unique ARN (Amazon Resource Name) of the restore testing plan.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingPlanResponse.RestoreTestingPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanName.
The name cannot be changed after creation. The name consists of only alphanumeric characters and underscores. Maximum length is 50.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingPlanResponse.UpdateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdateTime.
This is the time the update completed for the restore testing plan.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateRestoreTestingSelection operation. Most elements except the RestoreTestingSelectionName can be updated with this request.
RestoreTestingSelection can use either protected resource ARNs or conditions, but not both. That is, if your selection has ProtectedResourceArns, requesting an update with the parameter ProtectedResourceConditions will be unsuccessful.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest.RestoreTestingPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanName.
The restore testing plan name is required to update the indicated testing plan.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest.RestoreTestingSelection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingSelection.
To update your restore testing selection, you can use either protected resource ARNs or conditions, but not both. That is, if your selection has ProtectedResourceArns, requesting an update with the parameter ProtectedResourceConditions will be unsuccessful.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest.RestoreTestingSelectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingSelectionName.
This is the required restore testing selection name of the restore testing selection you wish to update.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateRestoreTestingSelection operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionResponse.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
This is the time the resource testing selection was updated successfully.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionResponse.RestoreTestingPlanArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanArn.
Unique string that is the name of the restore testing plan.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionResponse.RestoreTestingPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingPlanName.
This is the restore testing plan with which the updated restore testing selection is associated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionResponse.RestoreTestingSelectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestoreTestingSelectionName.
This is the returned restore testing selection name.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRestoreTestingSelectionResponse.UpdateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdateTime.
This is the time the update completed for the restore testing selection.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Backup
Backup
Backup is a unified backup service designed to protect Amazon Web Services services and their associated data. Backup simplifies the creation, migration, restoration, and deletion of backups, while also providing reporting and auditing.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonBackupClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonBackupClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>
member.param: The region to connect.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CancelLegalHoldAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.CancelLegalHoldRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This action removes the specified legal hold on a recovery point. This action can only be performed by a user with sufficient permissions.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CancelLegalHold service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CancelLegalHold service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
Backup is already performing an action on this recovery point. It can't perform the action you requested until the first action finishes. Try again later.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CancelLegalHold Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateBackupPlanAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupPlanRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Creates a backup plan using a backup plan name and backup rules. A backup plan is a document that contains information that Backup uses to schedule tasks that create recovery points for resources.
If you call CreateBackupPlan with a plan that already exists, you receive an AlreadyExistsException exception.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateBackupPlan service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateBackupPlan service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: The required resource already exists.
Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum number of items allowed in a request.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateBackupPlan Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateBackupVaultAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupVaultRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Creates a logical container where backups are stored. A CreateBackupVault request includes a name, optionally one or more resource tags, an encryption key, and a request ID.
Do not include sensitive data, such as passport numbers, in the name of a backup vault.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateBackupVault service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateBackupVault service method, as returned by Backup.

Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum number of items allowed in a request.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateBackupVault Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateFrameworkAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateFrameworkRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a framework with one or more controls. A framework is a collection of controls that you can use to evaluate your backup practices. By using pre-built customizable controls to define your policies, you can evaluate whether your backup practices comply with your policies and which resources are not yet in compliance.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateFramework service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.

member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateFramework Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateLegalHoldAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLegalHoldRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This action creates a legal hold on a recovery point (backup). A legal hold is a restraint on altering or deleting a backup until an authorized user cancels the legal hold. Any actions to delete or disassociate a recovery point will fail with an error if one or more active legal holds are on the recovery point.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateLegalHold service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateLegalHold service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum number of items allowed in a request.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateLegalHold Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVaultRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This request creates a logical container to where backups may be copied.
This request includes a name, the Region, the maximum number of retention days, the minimum number of retention days, and optionally can include tags and a creator request ID.
Do not include sensitive data, such as passport numbers, in the name of a backup vault.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVault service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVault service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: The required resource already exists.

Indicates that something is wrong with the input to the request. For example, a parameter is of the wrong type.
A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum number of items allowed in a request.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateLogicallyAirGappedBackupVault Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateRestoreTestingPlanAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingPlanRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This is the first of two steps to create a restore testing plan; once this request is successful, finish the procedure with request CreateRestoreTestingSelection.
You must include the parameter RestoreTestingPlan. You may optionally include CreatorRequestId and Tags.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateRestoreTestingPlan service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateRestoreTestingPlan service method, as returned by Backup.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateRestoreTestingSelectionAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateRestoreTestingSelectionRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This request can be sent after CreateRestoreTestingPlan request returns successfully. This is the second part of creating a resource testing plan, and it must be completed sequentially.
This consists of RestoreTestingSelectionName, ProtectedResourceType, and one of the following:
ProtectedResourceArns
ProtectedResourceConditions
Each protected resource type can have one single value.
A restore testing selection can include a wildcard value ("*") for ProtectedResourceArns along with ProtectedResourceConditions. Alternatively, you can include up to 30 specific protected resource ARNs in ProtectedResourceArns.
Cannot select by both protected resource types AND specific ARNs. Request will fail if both are included.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateRestoreTestingSelection service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.DeleteRecoveryPointAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.DeleteRecoveryPointRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Deletes the recovery point specified by a recovery point ID.
If the recovery point ID belongs to a continuous backup, calling this endpoint deletes the existing continuous backup and stops future continuous backup.
When an IAM role's permissions are insufficient to call this API, the service sends back an HTTP 200 response with an empty HTTP body, but the recovery point is not deleted. Instead, it enters an EXPIRED state.
EXPIRED recovery points can be deleted with this API once the IAM role has the iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole action. To learn more about adding this role, see Troubleshooting manual deletions.
If the user or role is deleted or the permission within the role is removed, the deletion will not be successful and will enter an EXPIRED state.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteRecoveryPoint service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteRecoveryPoint service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
Indicates that something is wrong with the input to the request. For example, a parameter is of the wrong type.
Backup is already performing an action on this recovery point. It can't perform the action you requested until the first action finishes. Try again later.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteRecoveryPoint Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Applies Backup Vault Lock to a backup vault, preventing attempts to delete any recovery point stored in or created in a backup vault. Vault Lock also prevents attempts to update the lifecycle policy that controls the retention period of any recovery point currently stored in a backup vault. If specified, Vault Lock enforces a minimum and maximum retention period for future backup and copy jobs that target a backup vault.
Backup Vault Lock has been assessed by Cohasset Associates for use in environments that are subject to SEC 17a-4, CFTC, and FINRA regulations. For more information about how Backup Vault Lock relates to these regulations, see the Cohasset Associates Compliance Assessment.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
Indicates that something is wrong with the input to the request. For example, a parameter is of the wrong type.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.
This operation does not support continuous backups.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.

Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle Operation

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup
member.summary:
Interface for accessing Backup
Backup
Backup is a unified backup service designed to protect Amazon Web Services services and their associated data. Backup simplifies the creation, migration, restoration, and deletion of backups, while also providing reporting and auditing.

member.summary:
This request can be sent after CreateRestoreTestingPlan request returns successfully. This is the second part of creating a resource testing plan, and it must be completed sequentially.
This consists of RestoreTestingSelectionName, ProtectedResourceType, and one of the following:
ProtectedResourceArns
ProtectedResourceConditions
Each protected resource type can have one single value.
A restore testing selection can include a wildcard value ("*") for ProtectedResourceArns along with ProtectedResourceConditions. Alternatively, you can include up to 30 specific protected resource ARNs in ProtectedResourceArns.
Cannot select by both protected resource types AND specific ARNs. Request will fail if both are included.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup.DeleteRecoveryPointAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.DeleteRecoveryPointRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Deletes the recovery point specified by a recovery point ID.
If the recovery point ID belongs to a continuous backup, calling this endpoint deletes the existing continuous backup and stops future continuous backup.
When an IAM role's permissions are insufficient to call this API, the service sends back an HTTP 200 response with an empty HTTP body, but the recovery point is not deleted. Instead, it enters an EXPIRED state.
EXPIRED recovery points can be deleted with this API once the IAM role has the iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole action. To learn more about adding this role, see Troubleshooting manual deletions.
If the user or role is deleted or the permission within the role is removed, the deletion will not be successful and will enter an EXPIRED state.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DeleteRecoveryPoint service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the DeleteRecoveryPoint service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
Indicates that something is wrong with the input to the request. For example, a parameter is of the wrong type.
Backup is already performing an action on this recovery point. It can't perform the action you requested until the first action finishes. Try again later.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DeleteRecoveryPoint Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Applies Backup Vault Lock to a backup vault, preventing attempts to delete any recovery point stored in or created in a backup vault. Vault Lock also prevents attempts to update the lifecycle policy that controls the retention period of any recovery point currently stored in a backup vault. If specified, Vault Lock enforces a minimum and maximum retention period for future backup and copy jobs that target a backup vault.
Backup Vault Lock has been assessed by Cohasset Associates for use in environments that are subject to SEC 17a-4, CFTC, and FINRA regulations. For more information about how Backup Vault Lock relates to these regulations, see the Cohasset Associates Compliance Assessment.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
Indicates that something is wrong with the input to the request. For example, a parameter is of the wrong type.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.

The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “retention” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Resource types that are able to be transitioned to cold storage are listed in the "Lifecycle to cold storage" section of the Feature availability by resource table. Backup ignores this expression for other resource types.
This operation does not support continuous backups.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.

Indicates that a required parameter is missing.

The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup.UpdateRegionSettingsAsync(Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Updates the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If service-opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does not try to protect that service's resources in this Region. Use the DescribeRegionSettings API to determine the resource types that are supported.

member.summary:
Most elements except the RestoreTestingSelectionName can be updated with this request.
RestoreTestingSelection can use either protected resource ARNs or conditions, but not both. That is, if your selection has ProtectedResourceArns, requesting an update with the parameter ProtectedResourceConditions will be unsuccessful.
